Section.Paragraph: Spoken Language Systems will require integration of continuous speech recognition and natural language processing. This is a proposed specification for an interface between a continuous speech recognizer (CSR) and a natural language processor (NLP) to form a spoken language system.

Both components are integrated with a stack controller and contribute to the search control. The specification also defines a "Top-N" mode in which a "first part" outputs a list of top N scored sentences for postprocessing by a "second part". An additional use for this specification might be NLP evaluation testing: a common simulated CSR could be interfaced to each site's NLP to provide identical testing environments.
